name: Histopathology Research Paper (Hierarchical)
description: Hierarchical template for histopathology research papers with grouped fields (21 variables in 6 logical groups)
system_prompt: You are an expert in medical research paper analysis, specializing in histopathology and medical imaging. Extract structured data with precision, organizing information into logical hierarchical groups.
user_prompt_template:
Extract information from this histopathology research paper as valid JSON with hierarchical structure.

IMPORTANT RULES:
1. Use null for any information you cannot find
2. Be precise - only extract what is explicitly stated
3. Do not make assumptions or infer information
4. Organize data into the specified hierarchical groups
5. Return ONLY valid JSON, no explanations, no markdown

Extract these variables organized in groups:
{variables_list}

Document excerpt:
---
{text}
---

Respond with ONLY a JSON object following this exact hierarchical schema:
{json_schema}

properties.name: paper_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the paper (if mentioned)

properties.name: title
properties.description: Full title of the research paper

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Type of tissue analyzed (e.g., skin, lung, breast)

properties.name: stain_normalization
properties.description: Staining normalization method used (e.g., H&E, Reinhard, Macenko)

properties.name: supervision_type
properties.description: Type of supervision (supervised, semi-supervised, unsupervised, weakly-supervised)

properties.name: core_architecture
properties.description: Specific architecture used (ResNet, U-Net, Vision Transformer, etc.)

properties.name: primary_metrics
properties.description: Primary evaluation metrics used (accuracy, F1, AUC, etc.)

properties.name: object_level_metric
properties.description: Object-level metrics (Dice, IoU, pixel accuracy, etc.)

variables.name: discussion
variables.description: Limitations, future work, and clinical application

output_format.null_handling: Use null for missing data (not 'N/A' or empty string)
